oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crowds; Judicial proceedings; Drugstores
Scopes, John Thomas; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Crowd of people gathering in front of Robinson's Drugstore during the Scopes trial.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Robinson's Drugstore, owned by F.E. Robinson, gained notoriety during the Scopes Trial. Mr. Robinson, among others, developed the plan to bring a test case of the Butler Law to Dayton while sitting at a table in the drugstore. The drugstore was the; place to hear the latest news and gossip of the trial.
